item.title: José Carlos Mariátegui - Outline of an Explanation of Chaplin
item.description: The Chaplin issue seems to me, within any explanation of our times, no less considerable than the Lloyd George issue or the MacDonald issue (if we look for equivalents in Great Britain alone). Many have found Henri Poulaille’s assertion that The Gold Rush (En pos del oro and La quimera del oro are barely approximate translations of this title) is the greatest contemporary novel to be excessive.
